main_definition: Dark refers to the absence of light or something that is not illuminated, as well as metaphorically to various negative or mysterious connotations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Lacking in light; having no sunlight
meanings_and_examples.example: The room was dark after the power outage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not illuminated, difficult to see clearly
meanings_and_examples.example: I couldn't find my keys because it was so dark in the car.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Mysterious or unknown; not easily understood
meanings_and_examples.example: The dark origins of that old legend have always intrigued me.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to evil, cruel intentions, or unpleasantness
meanings_and_examples.example: The movie's plot had a particularly dark theme.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Intense and profound; deep emotional states
meanings_and_examples.example: She entered into the darkest moments of her life after losing her job.
